fields.summary: Town Center Foundation - CID: 843 - Single Statement Issue for Acct 79-07-0250-1-6

content.text: Consulted Supervisors and was advised to set up triage ticket for further research to find root cause, see issue details below:
For the statement dated 12/16/2024 an error occurred during the Printing Process on 12/13/24 for Acct: 79-07-0250-1-6.

The print request excel file in Row 5 - Column CP shows the amount $0.00 when the customer had current charges of $34.50. The Due After 01/20/2025 amount was then blank when printing statement. While the payments received in the amount of $69.00 on the statement and those payments dates are correct, the account balance history does not reflect a credit.

Attached is copies from One Drive of the excel file and the print files dated 12/13/24. I have screenshots below of the balance history for this account and the highlighted section of the statement with the incorrect information. I also attached a print generated on 02/21/25 to show how this part of the statement should have looked.

fields.summary: CID: 1120 - Invoice Miscalculation – Late Fee and Deposit Issue

content.text: On the final bills generated by the client, the
total is displaying an amount higher than the expected 10% late fee. I have attached an example of a final bill for reference.
To clarify, the account balance itself reflects the correct amount—this miscalculation only appears on the invoice. I found a workaround by removing the
field from the bill, which allows the statement to display correctly.
However, when this field is included, the total due shows an overage of
Upon further investigation, I found that the client applied
twice to the customer's balance. It appears that the system may be incorrectly treating deposits as a balance owed instead of the amount paid to the account.
Please review this issue and advise on a resolution. Let me know if you need any additional information.

fields.summary: CID: 152 - Nuvei/Paya - Back-to-Back Payment Issue Due to Base Charge Success and Fee Fail

content.text: I found out that Jim along with Engineering has a process in place for Nuvei/Paya payments to be added to the account (they are not automatically applied) when the base charge is approved (shows as success in MB) and the fee is declined (fail in MB).
We have a client who is having a customer service issue due to the customer making back-to-back payments.
This happens because of what the customer sees when making a payment for the below scenario:
Customer receives a “Failed Payment” message when the base charge is approved and the fee fails so the customer makes another payment (therefore the back-to-back payments)
There is a delay on the first payment showing up on the customer’s account in MuniBilling so when the customer goes to make the second payment there is still a balance showing
The delays in the payments showing up on the customer accounts in MuniBilling and the “Failed Payment” message that the customer receives is causing customer and client issues.
The Failed Payment message seems to be a little deceiving as the customer thinks that the payment completely failed as they are unaware that there are two parts to it.

Another issue this causes is once the 2 payments are on the account one needs to be returned on the account in MuniBilling then the client needs to go into Nuveij/Paya and refund the payment.  On top of that, the client is then charged $10 for returning the payment.

- After these screenshots were taken Jai went into the payment on the “Payment History” screen and updated the fee to success to add the payment to the account then went in and changed it back to “Fail” - This was only done on Cayla Clanton’s account# 02806-11 since these payments were made prior to the process being in place to add these types of payments to the accounts.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it's awaiting verification by the reporter. From here work items are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: CID 1472: Cortlandville - Late Fee Charges

content.text: The customer had a $55.00 credit when the account bill was generated.

The due after is adding 10% of current charges rather than 10% of the total due. It calculates the 10% on 213.90, which gives us $21.39, and then adds it to the $158.90, which gives us a total due of $180.29…which is incorrect.
The total due after April 30 should be 158.90x10%=15.89+158.90= $174.79.
Is this how the system is built, or is there a setting that needs to be changed?

fields.summary: IVR Testing

content.text: The IVR-based automated payment processing system.
The Twilio IVR(studio) flow will be created to do the following:
Thank you for contacting the automated payment system for [client name] provided
To continue in Spanish, press 2 (this should be in Spanish). If no choice is made,
send the caller to the English queue.
The below scripting will be supported in both English and Spanish. Validate Account
Please enter your account number, located on your most current statement, numbers only, followed by the pound key.
Caller enters the account number and presses the pound key. a.Jump to Step 4.
Caller does not enter the account number:
a. If there is no entry after 5 seconds, the message in Step 1 repeats.
b. If there is no entry after 5 seconds a second time, the message in Step 1 repeats.
c. If there is no entry after 5 seconds a third time, the message in Step 1 repeats i. We haven’t received a response on your end. Thank you for calling. Goodbye.
You have entered [repeats account number entry].
If this account number is correct, press or say 1. a.Jump to Step 7.
If you want to reenter the account number, press or say 2. a.System moves caller to Step 1.
Please hold while I retrieve your account information. a.If zero balance, proceed to Step 8.
b.If the account has a balance, proceed to Step 9.
8. If the account has a zero balance: a. This account does not have a payment due at this time.
b. If you want to enter another account number, press or say 1. i. If the caller presses or says 1, bring the caller back to Step 1.
c. If you would like to end this call, simply hang up or press or say 2. i. The caller hangs up. [call ends]
ii. The caller presses or says 2.
1. Thank you for calling. Goodbye. [system disconnects call]
If the account has a balance: a. Your current account balance is [$0.00].
make a payment with a credit card, press or say 1.
make a payment with your bank account, press or say 2.
10. Credit Card Payment a. If you would like to receive your receipt via text after making this payment, press or say 1.
b. Please enter the payment amount followed by the pound key.
c. You have entered a payment in the amount of [$0.00].
d. If this is correct, press or says 1. i. For absorb model clients, proceed to Step f.
e. Your payment in the amount of [$0.00} will include a convenience fee in the amount of [$0.00} for a total payment of [$0.00].
f. To accept and process this payment, please say your first and last name followed by the pound key.
g.Your payment is processing, please do not hang up.
i. If payment is approved: 1. Thank you. Your payment has been processed. Your confirmation number is
2. To repeat this information, press or say 1.
3. To end this call, simply hang up, press, or say 2. a.Caller hangs up [call ends].
i. Thank you for calling. Goodbye. [system ends call]
ii. If payment is not approved: 1. I’m sorry, but your payment has been declined.
2. To make this payment with a different payment method, press or say 1.
a.Route the caller back to Step 9.
11. Bank Account (ACH) Payment a. If you would like to receive your receipt via text after making this payment, press or say 1.
b. Please enter the payment amount followed by the pound key.
c. You have entered a payment in the amount of [$0.00]. i. For absorb model clients, proceed to Step f.
d. If this is correct, press or say 1.
e. Your payment in the amount of [$0.00} will include a convenience fee in the amount of [$0.00} for a total payment of [$0.00].
f. To accept and process this payment, please say your first and last name followed by the pound key.
g. Your payment is processing please do not hang up. i. If payment is approved by the processor. 1. Thank you. Your payment has been processed. Your confirmation number is
2. To repeat this information, press or say 1.
3. To end this call, simply hang up, press, or say 2. a.Caller hands up [call ends].
i. Thank you for calling. Goodbye. [system ends call]

fields.summary: Staging: When Paya Base Charge Fails, the Convenience Fee is stuck in "Processing" Remote Charge Status.

content.text: This issue was found while completing Test Case 10: Paya Transaction Amount Testing for
SAAS-1354 - QA Test Matrix (Full PGP Regression) - Test base amount accepted, convenience fee declined (part2)
When a Paya Credit Base Charge (Charge #2) Fails, the Convenience Fee (Charge #1) becomes stuck in the “Processing” Remote Status Code.
Screenshot Example of $5.10 Base Charge Fail, Convenience Fee stuck in “Processing” from Remote Charge ID:

When the Base Charge (Charge #2) fails (intentionally based on test reason codes or due to NSF), the Convenience Fee (Charge #1) should also fail.  (This behavior applies to Paya Credit and eCheck PGPs.)
The updated order of operations for Charge #2 and Charge #1 should be applied to Active Paya Non-Absorbed Payment Gateway Profiles (PGPs) and behave similarly for Paya Absorbed PGPs.

Non-Absorb Paya Credit and eCheck PGPs enabled, with Customer Portal 1. Additionally, the "Allow CC/eCheck/Autopay in User Portal" flag is True in the Company General Settings page. All charges submitted for processing on 08/07/25 were expected to fail and to return error reason codes as described in
→ from the Customer Search page select any customer account like
→ click the Impersonate button → click the Make A Payment button → click Pay Other Amount → enter $6.10 → and any credit card number (from
) into the Paya PayForm → click the SAVE button.
After payment has been declined → navigate to the

to view the declined payment is displayed as “Processing” in the “Remote Charges Needing Attention” section → click the dollar Amount to view the Remote Charge Record that displays the “Convenience Fee” is stuck in the “Processing” remote charge status (See remote charge screenshot above).

fields.summary: PostMortem for 5/29/2025 Paya outages

content.text: Today we experienced outages in paya payments due to wrong configuration accidentally applied to paya adapter (
Discovering the root cause required 6 people meeting with reps from QA, Dev and DevOps
The root cause was spotted by looking the logs in ArgoCD, something only DevOps has access to
I took 4+ hours from the time the issue was discovered to the time it was fixed

Implement automated end-to-end payments check trough Katalan / QA automation tool, which uses real (prepaid) credit card and real production account. Run this after every deploy to production. This will make it easy to assess health of payment integrations
Have a way to refund payment funds
Have appropriate audits/controls in place to make sure funds are not misused (like buying personal items off Amazon)
Our initial guidance to use “virtual” credit cards is not feasible b/c Paya doesn’t offer anything for us to use for testing and
is limited to individuals and sole proprietorships, thus the need for prepaid credit cards instead.

Implement a deeper status check in the paya adapter to ascertain whether it is properly configured for it’s respective back-end. In this particular case there are at least two evars that need to be in sync: [Paya back end domain]; [Paya auth key] When the evars are out os sync we cant talk to backend. The proposed status check would make an attempt to talk to backend and spit status error if failed. This will speed up troubleshooting next time this happens

fields.summary: Global (CID 1472 Cortlandville)- Late Fee Charges

content.text: Late fees are calculated and displayed on a bill based on the amount of new charges on a bill only. The  system does not take into consideration that if the customer has a credit (overpayment) that would lower the current balance and therefore lower the amount of the late.
The customer had a $55.00 credit when the account bill was generated.
New charges generated for $213.90 and the bill calculated the 10% late fee as $21.39.
The total due after math is calculated 213.90 - 55 +21.39 = $180.29

fields.summary: (liquibase) GLOBAL: Missing Active Record Validation on Deposit Charges

content.text: Active Record Validation on the Deposit Charges screen in all environments. When we attempt to delete an existing Deposit Charge which has dependent customer records with deposit charges associated. There is no Validation (On screen error message) generated notifying the user that these records cannot be deleted due to associated Deposit Charge Records.

When a user attempts to delete an existing Deposit Charge which has Active Customer Deposit Charges attached - the user should receive an on screen error indicating “Deposit Charges Cannot be deleted due to Dependent Customer Account Deposit Charge Records” or a message similar to the one in the image below:

Deposit Charges are normally added during the Implementations process and are not often deleted or edited after a new company goes live. This could be a possible reason why a validation doesn’t currently exist in the system.
Navigate to any company which has the “Display Deposit Charge” flag enabled on → Admin-dashboard → Manage - General Settings Page. NOTE: Most Managed Services Company has this flag enabled.
In Staging, navigate to the City of Zephyrhills (1088) -
Navigate to → System Info → Deposit Charges (
Attempt to delete an existing Deposit Charge - this is where the error is supposed appear after user clicks “OK” in the Information modal → “Are you sure you wish to delete this record?”
Add a new Deposit Charge - after saving the newly added deposit charge observe that it does take more then 30 seconds for the New Deposit Charge to be deleted.

fields.summary: GLOBAL: Globalize "Statement - Graph (InfoSend)" file format to be used for 3rd party printing.

content.text: Globalize the “Statement - Graph (InfoSend)” file format for use with our 3rd Party Printer - InfoSend.
Clients are requesting Statements containing a Metered Usage Graph which can be printed through our 3rd Party Printer (InfoSend).

) needs to insert past Posted Metered Usage and the Current Months Usage into to the Print Requst CSV file for active and inactive meters associated with Customer Accounts. Need to display up to 24 months of historical meter usage in the Graph.
MuniBilling Admin users need to be able to complete the following tasks:

Copy the “Statement - Graph (InforSend)” file format from one company to other companies within MuniBilling without having to submit a service request to have an Engineer to insert new Company Id before this file format can be used for 3rd Party Printing.

MB Admins need to be able to edit the “usage_history_label_1” - “usage_history_label_24” and “usage_history_usage_1” - “usage_history_usage_24” fields in the “Statement - Graph (InfoSend)” file format”.
Admin user should receive the Print Request CSV file (received at
) containing the unposted bill records containing Historical Meter Labels and Readings appearing in Columns EM - GF:
Up to 24 Month Meter Reading Labels should appear in Print Request CSV columns EM- FJ:
24 Month Historical Meter Readings should appear in columns FK - GF:

The “Statement - Graph” file format has already been mapped out with InfoSend per Heidi and Jai. I renamed this file format from “Statement - Graph hf” to “Statement - Graph (InfoSend)” in Production for the City of South Pasadena.
From Admin Dashboard navigate to the City of South Pasadena (1087)
Click “Copy File Format” link in left menu (
) . Select “Statement - Graph (InfoSend)” file format then click “Copy” button.
Once copied, navigate back to Admin Dashboard. From the General Settings Page of the City of South Pasadena (
) in the Printing section, from the “Third Party Printing File Format” select the “Statement - Graph (InfoSend)” file format then click the “Save” button  at the top of the page.
Select the “Reporting” link from the Left Menu (
), scroll down to verify, any changes applied will be auto-saved:
Impersonate admin, from the Seach screen navigate to any customer account then Enter a New Unposted Bill or create bulk bills from → Billing tab.
Navigate to → Billing Tab → Print Bills link (
), in the center column insert a Due Date and Penalty Date then click “Request Bill Printing” button.
will automatically be generated when “Auto Send Print Request” flag is enabled on General Settings page of selected company, and can be viewed on the Admin Jobs
unposted bills should appear below the Print Preview pane on the Print Bills page.)
- Admin user should receive the Print Request CSV file (received at
) containing the unposted bill records containing Historical Meter Labels and Readings appearing in Columns EM - GF:
Up to 24 Month Meter Reading Labels should appear in Print Request CSV columns EM- FJ:
24 Month Historical Meter Readings should appear in columns FK - GF:

fields.summary: Problems Posting Staged NACHA Payment Records

content.text: City of Gatlinburg, a large client, has experienced repeated issues recently when posting staged NACHA records.  (City of Redmond, another large client, has also experienced this problem.)  Recovering from the incomplete posting of NACHA payment records often requires significant effort.

The issue appears to arise, at least in part, because of the large number of NACHA records involved.  Gatlinburg now receives > 1,300 NACHA payments each month, and this appears to be too many for the system to reliably handle.
We need to optimize the posting process for imported NACHA payments to prevent it from failing so frequently for this client.
Gatlinburg issues have been reported in
NACHA payment records go through a special process, initiated via the NACHA report (
The records then get imported via a special process that parses the rigidly formatted NACHA data and stages the records.

By marking the “Stage Payment Records” checkbox and then the “Click Here” link (see screenshot above), the client then has an opportunity to review those records via the View Imported Payments screen.  After the review on that screen is complete, the user clicks the “Post Payments” button, which moves the staged records to the

The “Post Payments” process has been failing to complete for Gatlinburg especially in recent months - at least partly due to the large number of records.  The client then gets frustrated, tries to repost the records and does various other things that complicate recovery.

fields.summary: (Bi-County) Make Jobs::PostBillStagesJob stable, prevent failure from DB timeout

content.text: On Bi-County (CID 1690), the Jobs::PostBillStagesJob repeatedly fails due to a Mysql lock wait timeout error. Here is an example:
It fails when saving to the bills table, and the bills table may be busy from other users causing it to exceed the timeout.

#<ActiveRecord::LockWaitTimeout: Mysql2::Error::TimeoutError: Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction: INSERT INTO `bills` (`customer_id`, `bill_date`, `amount`, `penalty_date`, `posted_customer`, `posted_account_id`, `billing_type_id`, `note`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, `posted_customer_date`, `open_balance`, `accounts_receivable_account_id`, `cash_account_id`, `entered_user_id`) VALUES (2819998, '2024-04-08', 10.0, '2024-04-08', TRUE, 23769, 21468, 'IMPORTED - L - Late Charge', '2024-06-19 10:04:09', '2024-06-19 10:04:09', '2014-06-25 05:00:00', 10.0, 23765, 23763, 4588)>
We need to solve this issue, optimize this job, and prevent failure from db locking.

- (NOTE: bill_stages don’t always have a customer) Possibly group bill_stages by customer_id, and wrap the transaction around groups of bill_stages by customer. Also only update the customer balance once, instead of updating it for every bill_stage.
- Alternatively, batch by a number of bill_stages, not too big but bigger than 1 (like it currently does). Maybe a number like 10-100.
- It may be possible to do both of these things, group by customer AND batch by a set number, it gets confusing with the
Stubborn save to avoid the db lock/timeout we’re getting on the bills table?
Delete bill stage records at the end of the iteration vs after the loop. this will make job idempotent
Add a progress updater based on number of bill_stages processed

fields.summary: Re: PS-1570 Fw: Late Fee Charges

content.text: She's not on the late fee report because she's not late.

That part of the bill that says "DUE AFTER" such and such date is a reminder to them that if they pay after that date, they will incur a late fee, and what the total will be. That area of the bill has nothing to do with the customer actually being late. I shouldn't really have to explain that to you.
Also, not sure why you went back to a bill from May. The bill in question is from August.
My question was quite simple, and I am so confused as to why it goes back and forth so many times with pointing things out to me that I am already aware of, that have nothing to do with my question.
I didn't ask why did this customer get a late fee. I didn't ask why it wasn't listed as a line item. I didn't say they were supposed to be on the late fee report.
My question was simple and should not require any follow up questions from me.
Why is the "Due After 08/31/2025" $116.56, and not $91.56? The late fee assessed is $25 if they are late, NOT $50. I didn't change any settings or change any amounts due.

I asked this question to Herman a while ago and got no response, but all this back and forth really has me wondering if I am getting "help" from AI. Because I have yet to get a straight, solid answer on any of my questions.

I have let a lot of things go in the last 2 months because it just wasn't worth it, but now when a customer comes in questioning me on the information on their bill, and I can't answer it, it really looks bad on me, and seems as though I am trying to pull a fast one on my customers by telling them they owe more money than they actually do.
They are not showing up on the late fee report
The late fees are outlined if they are previously owed.
This is shared with City of Ranier and Edith Jenkinson.

If you have any other questions, please call us at 623-219-4740. Your patience is greatly appreciated during this new transition.

fields.summary: Fwd: Laurium Sewage vs. Water

content.text: I forwarded another customer who is having issues. I sent him the
information that was sent to me in reference to these issues. Please
advise. I was told to reference ticket number ps1071.
Subject: Re: Laurium Sewage vs. Water
Thanks for the advice but I'm sorry to report none of it worked. The
portal is convinced my chuckbellaire (Capitol C and small c) doesn't
exist.  When I try to change the password, I put in my email address
and it says it doesn't exist.
Funny thing is if I click on the manage my account in the email bill,
I go straight in.  It was, through your link mind you, taking me into
the Michigan Water Company account but I logged out of it so I could
get into the NHCWSA portal.  Can you confirm that I have auto pay set
up?  While in Germany I was using a credit card however I'd like to
use my Range Bank account for all bills going forward.
I've asked several times for my Germany APO address to be changed to
the address here in Laurium but it's still showing.  I got my bill so
is it just one of them annoyances?  Trust me, I get it.  I've been an
IT (Systems administrator for the Government) my whole adult life.
Portals are fickle.  I'm sending the screen grab's just in case.
On Mon, Aug 11, 2025 at 11:58 AM NHCWSA billing <nhcwsabilling@gmail.com> wrote:
> I have forwarded the info that support has sent me for people who are
> having log in issues. The account # is the same because we pay for
> meter readings from the water company and it helps to keep the
> information flowing correctly. The bill on our side is indeed $53.00.
> The information that I sent you below should help clear everything so
> you will be at the correct log in place. I know there was a glitch in
> the system when Munibilling had done an update which caused the crazy
> log in issues ..it just coincidentally brought to a place around her
> and not a different one that they take care of. I am also going to
> send out a direct link which should allow you to log in once you clear
> your cache. If you get in you will just disable autopay and then if
> you want to set up a different bank you will reenroll in autopay.
> Please let me know if you still have issues after this.
> Please use the URL below to access your MuniBilling Dashboard:
> Please have employees follow the first three key steps.
> Close all browser windows, clear your cache, then manually type your
> username and password. Saved or bookmarked credentials may not work.
> 2. Employees: Ensure they typed in the correct URL
> If you can’t recall your password, click "Forgot Password" on the
> On Sat, Aug 9, 2025 at 10:45 AM chuck bellaire <cbellaire@gmail.com> wrote:

> > I live at 440 Kearsarge St and I'm quite confused on the separation (if it exists) of my bill(s).  Nevermind that the account number is exactly the same between the two, my email from the North Houghton County Water and sewage authority with my bill showing a 53.00 amount due takes me to a Upper Michigan Water Company site where it states I owe 64.83.  I called last week and was assured I have been paying my bills yet I don't know how to log into my NHCWSA account to set up auto pay. My fear is if I did this while in Germany, it's using a bank account I intend to close as I'm now a Range Bank participant.  Who can I talk to about this?

fields.summary: Auto Pay Payments

content.text: I was wondering how the auto pay works for sure. We have been told that once a customer is set up for auto pay the amount will be deducted on the 21st of every month because that is our due date. Then if their payment gets returned for NSF they must go back into their online account and remove the auto pay and then set it all back up again in order for it to be taken out the following month. Is this correct or does the auto pay just automatically keep pulling each month even though a payment got returned. I have a customer account 00601703 who has had NSF return payment before and now it just took the July 21 payment of $1,114.72 again, which she is saying will be returned and they never signed back up for it. Would you please clarify how the auto pay works and needs done after a return payment?
